bibl.title: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Aurelio F. Concheso, April 24, 1954

div1.p: Hench informs the Cuban Ambassador that he is recovering from viral pneumonia and cannot attend the presentation of the Finlay Medals in Washington, D.C.

div1.head: Telegram from Philip Showalter Hench to Aurelio F. Concheso, April 24, 1954
div1.p:
WESTERN
UNION
W. P. MARSHALL, PRESIDENT

p.hi: Send the following message, subject to the terms on back hereof, which are hereby agreed to

div1.p:
Mr. Aurelio F. Concheso
Ambassador of Cuba
Cuban Embassy
Washington, D. C.

EXCEEDINGLY GRATEFUL FOR FRIENDSHIP OF CUBAN GOVERNMENT AND FOR THE
HIGH HONOR OF THE FINLAY DECORATION. AM AT HOME IN BED RECOVERING
FROM VIRUS PNEUMONIA. REGRET EXCEEDINGLY CANNOT ATTEND WASHINGTON
CEREMONY APRIL 29. MY VERY SINCERE THANKS.
